dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, hey, did you see this pretty big news from PwC, uh, in Hong Kong?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, hey, did you see this pretty big news from P w C, uh, in Hong Kong?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: PwC in Hong Kong has for the first time accepted payment in Bitcoin for its advisory services.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, yeah! The Bitcoin thing, right? Like, they’re now accepting crypto payments. That's wild.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, yeah! The Bitcoin thing, right? Like, they're now accepting crypto payments. That's wild.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: PwC in Hong Kong has for the first time accepted payment in Bitcoin for its advisory services.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! For their advisory services. Which, you know, is a first for them. Kind of a huge step.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! For their advisory services. Which, you know, is a first for them. Kind of a huge step.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: PwC in Hong Kong has for the first time accepted payment in Bitcoin for its advisory services.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: I mean, it makes sense, though. They’ve been working with so many companies in the digital asset space, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I mean, it makes sense, though. They've been working with so many companies in the digital asset space, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As the firm works increasingly with companies in the digital asset and crypto-currency space, it believes that accepting such payments will evolve into an element of doing business in the normal course.

dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. They're basically saying, Look, this is just gonna become, uh, part of normal business operations.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As the firm works increasingly with companies in the digital asset and crypto-currency space, it believes that accepting such payments will evolve into an element of doing business in the normal course.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [overlaps] Which, um, Raymund Chao, like, their Asia-Pacific Chairman, he pointed out it really shows they're embracing new tech.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which, um, Raymund Chao, like, their Asia-Pacific Chairman, he pointed out it really shows they're embracing new tech.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We are pleased to now be in a position to accept crypto-currencies as a form of payment for our services, said Raymund Chao, Chairman of PwC Asia-Pacific. This decision helps illustrate how we are embracing new technology and incorporating innovative business models across our full range of services.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and it's not just Bitcoin. They're talking about other established cryptocurrencies, too, becoming, you know, more broadly accepted forms of settlement.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and it's not just Bitcoin. They're talking about other established cryptocurrencies, too, becoming, you know, more broadly accepted forms of settlement.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It is also an indication that Bitcoin and other established crypto-currencies have now developed into more broadly accepted forms of settlement.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And it ties into all their other work, doesn't it? Like, advice on token sales, ICOs, crypto exchanges...
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And it ties into all their other work, doesn't it? Like, advice on token sales, I C O s, crypto exchanges...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This includes advice in areas such as token sales (also referred to as Initial Coin Offerings, or ICOs), crypto exchanges, and the launch of crypto funds.

dialogue_turns.text: Mmm-hmm. Even helping launch crypto funds. They're right in the thick of it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Mmm-hmm. Even helping launch crypto funds. They're right in the thick of it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This includes advice in areas such as token sales (also referred to as Initial Coin Offerings, or ICOs), crypto exchanges, and the launch of crypto funds.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It really just, uh, highlights how Distributed Ledger Technology and Blockchain are, like, changing everything. Even though it’s still relatively early days.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It really just, uh, highlights how Distributed Ledger Technology and Blockchain are, like, changing everything. Even though it's still relatively early days.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Disruptive digital products and services that have been developed through Distributed Ledger Technology (more commonly known as Blockchain), such as crypto-currencies or PwC's supply chain trust solution, are already transforming existing businesses in many areas, and it's still relatively early days for this technology, said Andrew Watkins, Chief Technology and Disruption Officer, PwC China and Hong Kong.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Andrew Watkins from PwC mentioned that – they want to be at the forefront of these exciting developments.

dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: said Andrew Watkins, Chief Technology and Disruption Officer, PwC China and Hong Kong. PwC is committed to being at the forefront of these exciting developments.

dialogue_turns.text: Right. And you've got Bitcoin and Ethereum, you know, leading the pack. Plus these new futures contracts from CME and CBOE.

dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Bitcoin and Ethereum are two of the most widely recognised crypto-currencies in an increasingly crowded field. The Chicago Mercantile Exchange and the Chicago Board Options Exchange have both announced plans to launch Bitcoin futures contracts, which will allow investors to hedge against movements in the currency.
